required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Avexitide Safety and Efficacy to Treat Acquired Hyperinsulinemic Hypoglycemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-Label, Cross-over Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Avexitide in Acquired Hyperinsulinemic Hypoglycemia

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of two different dosing regimens of an investigational drug called Avexitide in treating low blood sugar in patients with Acquired Hyperinsulinemic Hypoglycemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of diurnal Level 2 hypoglycemia events (ADA, <54 mg/dL) as measured by CGM in patients with severe HH
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Rate of Level 2 Hypoglycemia measured by CGM

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Level 2 hypoglycemia (ADA, <54 mg/dL) as measured by SMBG
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Rate of Level 2 Hypoglycemia
Change from Baseline in Rate of Level 3 Hypoglycemia (Severe Hypoglycemia)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent diurnal time <54 mg/dL as measured by CGM
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Percent diurnal time with Clinically Important Hypoglycemia (< 54mg/dL by Continuous Glucose Monitor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial glycemia during standardized mixed meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in glycemia During Standardized Mixed Meal Consumption

arm_group.description: Patients will receive one of the two dosing regimens of avexitide for 14 days followed by the other dosing regimen of avextide for 14 days
Patients will receive one of the two dosing regimens of avexitide for 14 days followed by the other dosing regimen of avextide for 14 days (in the opposite sequence from Treatment Group 1)

intervention.description: Avexitide (exendin 9-39) is a competitive antagonist of GLP-1 at its receptor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of bariatric or upper-gastrointestinal surgery (RYGB, VSG, gastrectomy, esophagectomy, or Nissen fundoplication) at least 12 months prior to the start of Screening
- History of recurrent hypoglycemia occurring after bariatric or upper-GI surgery, as documented in the medical record.
- Body mass index (BMI) of up to 40 kg/m2
- If female, must not be breastfeeding and must have a negative urine pregnancy test result
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major surgery within 6 months before randomization.
- History of or current hyperinsulinism other than Acquired Hyperinsulinism (e.g., insulin autoimmune hypoglycemia).
- Use of agents that may interfere with glucose metabolism
